Which brings me to my next point: story.The story is a mess. Whether you like the story (or stories\, I should say\, as one could easily argue that there are more)\, the real problem with the story is its structure: it is awful. It starts out solid\, and remains so throughout it's first chapter\, but following that it wanes in quality and becomes unsatisfying and at times\, very pretentious.Last of Us II is sequel to an amazing game\, that was always going to be hard to follow. In gameplay it certainly does not disappoint; it's faster\, more versatile\, more dynamic. The story however\, is a massive step down in quality - and I sincerely mean whether you liked the direction they chose or not. I didn't; but I can respect their choice. What I don't like is simply the broken structure. Really bad.My last note on this: I am definitely going to play Last of Us again. I do not know if I'll ever play LoU II again. The story gives me nothing but grief (in a bad way) and while the gameplay is really good\, it's not good enough to carry it for so many hours as the game takes to complete.… Expand
